result.execSummary:
Joshua Paul Schaffer was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Joshua Paul Schaffer was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua Paul Schaffer

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: mailed extradition paperwork to Gov Walker
Initial must be entered in order to dispose of this case.

4:34 pm 
Defendant Joshua Paul Schaffer in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  Defendant Joshua Paul Schaffer in custody.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Nelson:  def is willing to waive extradition back to Minnesota.  Def agrees.    Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.  Def has no questions.  Has GED.  Court approves the waiver and signs the same.
